top_categories.workout_context: 157 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Locos' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 157 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Gravel Locos' Smooth limestone gravel, Fast Hill Country ranch roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 157 miles.
157 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
7,884ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At Gravel Locos, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
50ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
7,884ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 7,884ft of climbing on smooth, fast Hill Country gravel with endless does to your power file on race day.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Locos. Train it until it feels boring.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on smooth, fast Hill Country gravel with endless. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.heat: May in Hico, Texas — Late May means starting warm and climbing into 80s-90s°F with high sun. 2022's Wahoo reading of 120°F on fresh tarmac shows how brutal heat reflection can be. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Gravel Locos — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day. Race-day realities: Heat and sun on open ranch roads; Dehydration risk is the primary concern.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 157 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 157 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Locos requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on smooth, fast hill country gravel with endless rollers to build confidence. Expect: smooth limestone gravel, fast hill country ranch roads, wildflower-lined paths.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Endurance to prepare you for 157 miles of smooth, fast hill country gravel with endless rollers in Hico, Texas.
